entries.meaning: (obsolete, except Scots) Stomach mucus, especially of a hawk.
(obsolete, except Scots) Any slimy, viscous substance.
(vulgar, slang) A urethral discharge, especially as a symptom of gonorrhoea.

verbs.description: gleet (third-person singular simple present gleets, present participle gleeting, simple past and past participle gleeted)

entries.meaning: To flow in a thin, limpid humour; to ooze, as gleet.
examples: "upon dilating a ſmall gleeting hole about three inches above the knee, on the outside of the thigh; and introducing a jointed or ſcrew probe, I found the bone carious to ſuch a height and withal the patient ſo emaciated with the tedious diſcharge, and a hectic fever that I diſſuaded attempting the operation"
gleet down the rocky Caverns of these Mountains
